sense.name: act of spreading
sense.commentary: DISTRIBUTION[+event] The act of spreading, scattering, or distributing. Can refer to both a one-time event and a regular activity or career.
sense.examples: Printing the flyers wasn't difficult, but their distribution across campus took all day! I supervise the distribution of Christmas bonuses among our employees. I was the supervisor of the Distribution department. The product had some interruptions in its distribution chain. Poorly-executed distribution can really kill a new product.

sense.name: state of being distributed
sense.commentary: The state of being spread out; the spatial property of being scattered over an area. Can also refer to the particular way that something is scattered (for example, the distribution of income).
sense.examples: There's a wide distribution of singing talent in this chorus. I'd say that Starbucks coffee shops have achieved a pretty good distribution across the country. Our newspapers have a strong distribution on campus. I wrote a paper on the current distribution of income in Canada.

sense.name: arrangement of values
sense.commentary: An arrangement of values for a variable that describes the frequency of a value's occurrence. Only refers to statistical values.
sense.examples: The test scores for the midterm fall into a classic Gaussian distribution. I studied the types of statistical distributions that numbers can fall into.
